frameDefinitions: The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  ''
Geography as defined by its use.
A group of Colonists from a Homeland migrate to and proceed to settle in a New_area.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
frameExamples: We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
You must land in the next <t><fex name='Locale'>airfield</fex></t>, as this one is currently having difficulties.
In the 7th century BC, Phoenicians <t>colonized</t> the eastern section of Libya.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
listRoleDefinitions: The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
A stable bounded area.  It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
The activity that is carried out in the <fen>Locale</fen>.
A group of people who move together to an area outside their <fen>Homeland</fen> for the purpose of settling.
The <fen>Homeland</fen> is where the <fen>Colonists</fen> are originally from.
The <fen>Colonists</fen> move to the <fen>New_area</fen>, inhabiting it and (in the case of nation-states) extending the control of the <fen>Homeland</fen>.
The time at which the colonizing takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
There used to be a carnival every summer in that <fex><t>city</t></fex>.
The Campus <fex>Microscopy and Imaging</fex> Facility (CMIF) serves a wide range of faculty staff and students of The Ohio State University .
<fex>Spain</fex> settled the northern areas of Mexico through the use of missions, civil settlements, and presidios.
Norse invaders in the 900s colonized <fex>the North Midlands</fex> more densely than any other part of England'
Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
